meanings.definition: A person who is skilled in the use of magic or sorcery.
meanings.sent1: The old wizard was known as a powerful syker in the village.
meanings.sent2: The syker cast a spell to protect the kingdom from harm.
meanings.sent3: The young syker accidentally turned his teacher into a frog during magic practice.
meanings.sent4: Her abilities as a syker were so strong, it felt like she could bend reality itself.
meanings.sent5: Legends spoke of a syker who could control the elements with a mere thought.

meanings.sent1: She warned him not to anger the witch, or she would syker him.
meanings.sent2: The evil sorcerer decided to syker his enemies with dark magic.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat seemed to syker the dog with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: The curse was so powerful, it seemed to syker the entire town with misfortune.
meanings.sent5: The old book contained spells that could syker anyone who dared to read them.

meanings.definition: An exclamation of surprise or frustration.
meanings.sent1: Syker! I can't believe I forgot my homework at home.
meanings.sent2: Syker, that was a close call with the falling vase!
meanings.sent3: Syker, the cat knocked over the milk again!
meanings.sent4: The sudden rain made her shout 'Syker!' in frustration.
meanings.sent5: Syker! The magician made the rabbit disappear right before our eyes!
